page.title: 11COLESBOURNE INDUSTRY
page.content: Farming is the main industry in the village. Many people work on the Colesbourne Estate. The Estate has 850 acres of forest,a mixture of deciduous and conifer woodlands and 1,500 acres of farmland.Just over half of the farmland (850 acres) is cultivated the main crops being barley and wheat.The remaining land is used as rough grazing for the sheep. About a thousand sheep are kept. There is a saw mill where several different sorts of trees are cut. The wood is used to make furniture,fence posts,pit props and sheds.Some timber is made up into sections for use locally to make animal and pheasant pens. The garage, service station and inn are other sources of employment. Some people work in one of the three neighbouring large towns and others have retired to the area.
